snippet: Prime Minister David Cameron suggested that on spending issues, it might be good to split the European Union in two.
abstract: News analysis; Britain could be on the verge of accepting, maybe even welcoming, two-tier European Union it has long resisted; Prime Min David Cameron is trying to redefine the country's relationship with the EU, and under domestic political pressure, is now willing to let Britain take a back seat.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister David Cameron suggested that on spending issues, it might be good to split the European Union in two.

headline.seo: Britain Rethinks Opposition to a Two-Tier E.U.
headline.main: Britain Rethinks Its Opposition to a Two-Tier Europe
headline.print_headline: Britain Rethinks Its Opposition to a Two-Tier E.U.
